definitions: a wire stretched close to the ground, working a trap, explosion, or alarm when disturbed and serving to detect or prevent people or animals entering an area

examples.text: he brushed some leaves aside to reveal a small tripwire stretched between two trees

shortDefinitions: wire stretched close to ground, working trap, explosion, or alarm

definitions: a comparatively weak military force employed as a first line of defense, engagement with which will trigger the intervention of strong forces

examples.text: if these peacekeeping efforts fail, they should have the function of a tripwire
the placing of tripwire forces on disputed borders

shortDefinitions: comparatively weak military force employed as first line of defence
